title: Community of Practice (CoP) Design Principles and Problem-Solving Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Science Knowledge and Experience with Collaborative Learning
context.additional_context: Strengthening community of practice construction and operational capabilities in science inquiry activities using smartphone-based VR simulations

learning_goals: Learners can explain five potential issues in designing communities of practice: prescriptive/technical vs. evolutionary characteristics, pre-structured vs. emergent properties, knowledge ownership vs. practical knowledge, middle-range theory vs. micro-learning theory, and voluntary vs. mandatory participation.
Learners can design and operate small-scale scientific inquiry communities in VR simulation environments.
Learners can develop at least three formative assessment tools that facilitate knowledge sharing among community members.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
